venue.address_2: Congress Street across from City Hall
venue.name: Faneuil Hall (in front of the Samuel Adams statue)

item.description:
The Boston Waterfront was the epicenter of the maritime economy in the New World. From Dock Square to Rowes Wharf, this walk through Boston's mercantile history features tales of the colonial shoreline, the lore of clipper ships, and the vibrant commerce of today's shops and restaurants.

On this tour you will walk along four centuries of Boston's ever-changing coastline and waterfront architecture. From John Smibert's 1742 Faneuil Hall to the modern day Rowes Wharf, this tour of discovery is filled with artifacts and clues of New England's great seafaring heritage.

Tickets for the tour are $15 per person ($5 for Boston By Foot card holders -- see www.bostonbyfoot.org for information about getting one).
item.how_to_find_us: Find guides with Boston By Foot signs and buttons in front of Faneuil Hall.
item.name: Tour of Boston's Waterfront
